isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9400, AND 9900 MODELS - POWER DISTRIBUTION AND GROUND SYSTEM - OPERATION - 3+1 Battery System

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to 12V POWER DISTRIBUTION - 3+1 BATTERY SYSTEM circuit diagram, in CTS-5119W or CTS-5273W for the following discussion. The 3+1 battery system includes three cranking batteries and one deep cycle battery. The purpose of this system is to prevent discharging the three cranking batteries while operating certain electrical accessories connected to (B2), off the fourth battery, when the engine is not running.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Running Mode
svcsubproc.para: With the engine running, power (7 volts) from the alternator "R" terminal energizes the isolated battery magnetic switch, closing the contacts. This links the positive terminal of the deep cycle and cranking motor batteries, recharging all four batteries and supplying power from all four batteries to both the (B1) and (B2) battery studs.

svcsubproc.title: Engine OFF Mode
svcsubproc.para: The deep cycle battery supplies power to the (B2) battery stud. Refer to 12V POWER DISTRIBUTION - 3+1 BATTERY SYSTEM circuit diagram, in CTS-5119W or CTS-5273W for components receiving power from the (B2) stud.

The three cranking batteries supply power to the (B1) battery stud. Refer to 12V POWER DISTRIBUTION - BATTERY circuit diagram, in CTS-5119W or CTS-5273W for components receiving power from the (B1) stud with the key OFF or ON.

If the key switch is in the on or accessory position with the engine off, refer to 12V POWER DISTRIBUTION - ACCESSORY and 12V POWER DISTRIBUTION - IGNITION in CTS-5119W or CTS-5273W for power distribution.
